text: Facebook has turned the big-10
10 years of comments likes and let's be
honest
procrastination here's how it looked in
2004 back then Facebook was only open to
Harvard University students fast forward
to a decade later and here's how things
look with Facebook's 1.2 billion users
81% are outside the US and Canada on
average seven hundred and fifty seven
million people log on each day in 2013
the top topic of conversation was Pope
Francis the top life events people
shared dealt with relationship statuses
speaking of relationships it's not all
roses in cyberspace one study found 80%
of u.s. divorce attorneys have seen more
cases involving social media and
Facebook can be a lonely place a
University of Michigan study found the
more young adults used Facebook the
worse they felt still other studies have
found spending time on Facebook can
boost self-esteem
either way think about it these
psychological implications of internet
use weren't really around back in 2004
neither was internet privacy a big topic
over the years the Internet has been
awash with how tubes are navigating
facebook's privacy settings and locking
down profiles it can be confusing stuff
what began on college campuses is now
big business with older crowds one
survey found the highest rate of growth
is with folks 65 and older meanwhile
Facebook is losing parts of the youth
crowd to services like snapchat still
Facebook isn't in such a bad position at
the end of 2013 it reported having
eleven point five billion dollars in
cash on hand
David Botti BBC News Washington
